page.title: 05EVENTS
page.content: Certain events occur every year. The Church has a fete on the field next to it; the school has a fete and a sports day; there is also a road race on August Bank Holiday which starts at the Prince of Wales pub. Money is raised for the Newent disabled club. The church often organises cheese and wine evenings and supper at people's homes. To help raise funds, dances are held every week in the village hall. The last important event was the celebration of the Silver Jubilee of the Queen in 1977. A party was held on the playing field for the people of Corse and Staunton. Commemerative mugs were given to all the children. The school and playgroup had a tea-party for the wedding of Prince Charles and Lady Diana.
